TopicTitle: Think again about leaving kerbals stranded

Articles.Content:
To be fair, I don't think anyone in the space program was fooling themselves that it wasn't dangerous, especially not after Apollo One.

They were as sure as they could be that it would work, but it had never been done before, and you can never be 100% sure about anything.

I can understand that but Nasa - and the government - would rather save $$$ than to save their lives...

I never leave a Kerbal behind except at a colony.

However, I am forming a Mun Colony and am planning a group of Laythe Colonies (different islands).

Any other planets/ moons are to be occupied until the Kerbals can return to either the Kerbin Hotel, the Mun Colony or (in the future) the Laythe Colonies.

Slightly off-topic: Why did NASA make the FIRST FLIGHT IN THE PROGRAM manned?

They didn't. There were several unmanned suborbital test flights.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apollo_program#Unmanned_flight_tests

Apollo 1 was specifically to be the first manned flight.

I had an experimental lander crash (spectacularly) on the Mun, stranding its crew of three Kerbals. I quickly fitted out a tried and true lander as an automated rescue ship to fetch them. The best of both worlds: the crew were rescued without additional risk of lives.

The families of the astronauts who died requested that they be given the "Apollo 1" designation out of respect; despite the flight having not officially happened since the accident was during a test. NASA agreed, even though it messed up the mission numbering.

The fun for me is in over designing my rockets (so that they can handle things I didn't foresee, which happens often), and if worst comes to worst, the challenge of creating a rescue vehicle, which presumably has to be better than whatever vehicle got someone stranded in the first place. I've mounted a rescue a few times, and killed kerbals even more. But I don't leave them behind, they all have a ticket home, or one is on the way.

Since in KSP 0.20 you will be able to change root part and change pod/payload in vanilla game.

This will allow to refine rocket design using probe body and mass simulator (stack of fuel tanks with similar mass) first and attach later new pod/payload without rebuilding the craft .
I have rescue plans in place for my Kerbals. They work as well, I managed to get 3 back from Minmus after the pod fell off the rocket!

The closest I am to abandoning Kerbals is the 4 kerbs I have in my station around Vall, currently waiting for the resupply ships.

Since my space program is stupidly well established, we have eschewed parachutes in exchange for a regular shuttle back to Kerbin.
Welp, since funding is not an issue, I send rescue craft to save stranded kerbals =D

I never used to rescue them. however, I've gotten a lot better at the game lately, so upon updating to 0.19.1 I restarted my entire space program. When I did this, I told myself that every kerbal I spawned counted, and that no lives would be lost anymore. I've kept up with it so far... Pretty proud of myself not gonna lie. I have begun developing some interplanetary transports, so we'll see how that goes
